intro: Jasminum didymum subsp. racemosum, commonly known as the racemosum jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas and along riverbanks.
